name: Nicotinamide (Niacinamide / Vitamin B3)
description: Amide form of vitamin B3, distinct from niacin (no flushing). NAD+ precursor via the salvage pathway. Shown to reduce skin cancer risk and support DNA repair. Used in dermatology for photoprotection and in oncology for skin cancer prevention at 500mg 2x/day.

dosage.notes: Does NOT cause flushing (unlike niacin). ONTRAC trial dose: 500mg 2x/day for skin cancer prevention. Very affordable. Different mechanism from NMN/NR.

keyFindings: ONTRAC trial: 23% reduction in new skin cancers at 500mg 2x/day
Effectively raises NAD+ via salvage pathway
Enhanced DNA repair capacity in UV-exposed skin
contraindications: Gout (may increase uric acid at very high doses)
